newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy terracotta group Deroma requests listing.
newsitem.headline: Italy terracotta group Deroma requests listing.

text.p: Italian terracotta pot-maker Deroma Holding Spa has asked stock market regulator Consob for admission to the Milan bourse.
A statement from Deroma, which is based in Malo near the northern town of Vicenza, said it had asked Consob on December 6 for quotation for its ordinary stock.
The company, a leading maker of terracotta pots, said that subject to Consob authorisation, it expected to enter the stock market early in 1997.

Deroma said its first half 1996 consolidated turnover rose 5.5 percent from the same 1995 period to 75.3 billion lire, with a net profit of 9.3 billion lire, up 12 percent on the first six months of 1995.
